alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Santa Barbara; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 1:10AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy rain continues across the area early this morning capable of producing urban and small stream flooding. * WHERE...Southeastern Santa Barbara County, southern and central Ventura County, and far western Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 515 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.40 inches per hour have been observed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Malibu, Ojai, Chatsworth, Montecito, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Carpinteria, and Newbury Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
